creator: dev@tomcat.apache.org
text:
I think it would be really useful if WAR archives would auto-update just like JSPs and servlets are supposed to.  I think a lot of people shy away from WARs partially because it would involve stopping and starting Tomcat.

I like WARs though because they would make the deployment much easier.  Also, this would allow ISP's to more easily allow a deployment interface where administrators could upload a WAR archive and have it automatically deployed...

If it is decided that this would be a good thing to implement, I would like to help out.  Please contact me at seanblaes@engineer.com...

creator: cmanolache@yahoo.com
text:
I made few changes to make it easy to implement, need to look in AutoDeploy
and add the missing code - it's not critical, so if you need it you should
send a PATCH. Missing: implement the reload() hook to re-expand, and check if
the war is newer the first time.

Note: Default will remain as in previous versions, i.e. do not expand if the 
dir is there - people may edit files and they shouldn't have the files removed.

Note2: It would be perfect to also have an admin page - not hard to do, but 
someone needs to do it:-)
